title: So new Mordekaiser gets to have high single target damage and waveclear
body:
On top of having shield to deny aggression into a heal. and forcing you into his 1v1 me bruh ult.
I have no problem with him being a strong 1v1 duelist (even if he is overtuned) but why the wave clear. We all know that he isnt going back Mid hes gonna stay top to bully people who dont have as short cooldowns or high damage.

replies.body:
He's basically another Darius.

He's big, immobile, has a pull, has a heal, has great single target damage, has great wave clear and when he is fed he will destroy your whole team

Riot took a unique champion and replaced him with the rerework of Darius

> [{quoted}](name=Bastilean,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=xiMeHHy3,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-06-02T22:22:45.059+0000)
>
> He's basically another Darius.
> 
> He's big, 

What kind of argument is this? Riot designs juggernauts to be big to represent their class.

> immobile,

Again, he's a juggernaut so he *has* to be immobile.

>  has a pull

You'd know both pulls functions differently if you've played both of them a good amount, 

> has a heal,

Dude, yet again, the majority of juggernauts have some form of sustain(Garen, Illaoi, Nasus, Mundo, Aatrox, etc,.)

>  has great single target damage, 

Zzzzz. Like virtually *every juggernaut in the game*, because they are bad at teamfighting.

> has great wave clear 

Coincidence

> and when he is fed he will destroy your whole team

Like most juggernauts as well...

> Riot took a unique champion and replaced him with the rerework of Darius

Not even close, all you did was list features a juggernaut has
Not to mention AP itemization is completely different from AD itemization

> Again, he's a juggernaut so he has to be immobile.

Wasn't he first a mage bruise type? That later Riot tried to squeeze into ADC role (lol)?

I mean if you really want we can just juggle his class a bit more. Why won't he be an ADC assassin tank jungling supporting mage with a pinch of bruiser?

Just cause he's "teh jugg bruh" doesn't mean he has to be generic carbon copy of Darius, but with less axe and more mace.

> [{quoted}](name=R107 Games,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=xiMeHHy3,comment-id=00020002,timestamp=2019-06-02T23:21:32.824+0000)
>
> Again, he's a juggernaut so he *has* to be immobile.

Just chiming in here.

He doesn't have to be immobile because he's a Juggernaut.
He has to be a immobile to *be* a Juggernaut.

Cause: Immobility
Effect: tuned to have Juggernaut stats

Not the other way around.

:)

> He's basically another Darius.

> 
> Riot took a unique champion and replaced him with the rerework of Darius

As someone who likes playing Sion when he isn't dumpstered, having an AP Jug like this is very appealing as Mord seems to be able to play up close, or skirmish in and out of threat range, engaging when getting a pick. Don't have that all that much tbh. Especially not as immobile tanky.
Daruis doesnt have as good wave clear as Mordekaiser and if he built full damage to get that much he'd be easily popped.

old morde used to have insane wave clear, so i like they are going back to that.

its easy to make things sound op when they might not be
Mord's probably going to be played mid as a melee counter (similar to current Mord actually)

Morde has always been a waveclear champ, and it would be against the spirit of the champ to remove it. Plus there are other champs who are way more mobile and overloaded that have the same or better waveclear. His damage numbers just need tuning tbh.

If this is so you cant then have him also have god like dueling, them intentionally making him ap darius with more damage.
He's always been a buggy champ too and his Q has always hit one person at a time. but thats the point of the rework to change some things.

> [{quoted}](name=LordGeovanni,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=xiMeHHy3,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-06-02T22:21:41.182+0000)
>
> If this is so you cant then have him also have god like dueling, them intentionally making him ap darius with more damage.
> He's always been a buggy champ too and his Q has always hit one person at a time. but thats the point of the rework to change some things.

Every AD champ has god like wave clear after building tiamat though? And there is no ap equivalent of it. Also, you're wrong about his Q, the pre-juggernaut Morde had and AoE Q(Morde was actually known for being the best farming champ in the game at the time) with isolation damage, and it was just a point and click version of new Morde's Q.
Current mordekaiser either goes W for sustain and pushing power or Q for dueling power he cant do both in lane at the same time. He has to wait well until the mid game to do the other.
*Looks at Darius* Meh I don't see anything wrong here, if he is gonna be a 1vs1 bully duelist and wave clear then soo be it. Since Darius current state is considered FINE by riot, so is morde.
Darius doenst have half the wave clear new mordekaiser does and he has to sacrifice damage to build defense to stand up to people while mordekaiser doesnt

So.. Isolation damage or AOE and R %damage single target. W+E was waveclear. This is kit iteration #1.  All damage draintanked due to passive.

Q stacking single target damage. R % damage. WE Again. Wave clear. Kit iteration 2.  Damage still drain tanky due to passive.


Now... Q single target or aoe. R isolates a single target to be damaged. W and E are wave clear.  W passive provides less dramatic drain tank interaction.
